content: Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 09 Jan 2019There are several credit card promotions now, whereby if you sign up for the cards through SingSaver, you get CASH of about $150-$200. Is this legit?I read through the T&C but couldn't find any catch. Can anyone enlighten me?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 02 May 2019Legit. Just make sure you're new to bank (never own any card from the same bank or at least cancelled the car one year before you apply ). Besides Singsaver, GoBear also does similar but offer cash or voucher or prizes.0 comments0

Aik KaiLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 02 May 2019Yes it is legit.The idea behind it is called Affiliate Marketing. Basically if you apply for a card through SingSaver, the bank will pay SingSaver some money for bringing in a customer. SingSaver will then pass you some of the money/reward they get from the bank.0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 10 Jan 2019Yes Singsaver is legit and has been around for quite long. They help to do marketing so that's how they earn.0 comments0
